column4: ok so very quickly.....the extended partition is a 20gig fat32 with a logical drive of the same sie in it......and there's 20gigs of free space....where i can't create more than two partitions....deleting the extended partition is not an option cuz i have data i need there
make the extended partition (but not the logical partiion inside) bigger
do you have gparted?
well that uses gparted for the normal installer so thats fine
im just checking
you can move sda2 to the beginning of the drive
then move sda5 back as far as poss and expand it to get the free space inside the extended partition then make new logical partitions in the extended partition at the end fo the drive
of course - backup first
u there?
am now,
you shouldn't need to change mountpoints or anything, just move the partitions about on disk
its a bit like the hanoi towers puzzle i guess
also, if you address your messages to me (type my name at the beginning of the message) my irc client will make sure I notice the message
try right clicking on it
you are using the desktop installer (gui), not the alternate (text) installer
yes desktop
hmmm - maybe the gparted installer used in the desktop cd is limited in functionality
try edit
that will sort it
http://gparted.sourceforge.net/documentation.php
I have to go eat lunch now but other people should be able to help you if you need more help
that site should help guide you through gparted
